content.question: Which of the following best explains the Soviet view of the Marshall Plan and the Truman Doctrine as expressed in the passage?

choices.label: Marshall Plan aid was offered to Eastern Europe as well as Western Europe.
The Marshall Plan and Truman Doctrine both tended to restrict the expansion of Soviet influence.
Soviet forces had suffered by far the largest number of casualties in the fight against Nazi Germany.
The Soviets wished to ensure that individual countries determined their own political and economic development without outside influence.

content.answer: The Marshall Plan and Truman Doctrine both tended to restrict the expansion of Soviet influence.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
